title: Understanding Muscular Dystrophy: Symptoms
author: Stephanie Watson

content: Dystrophy is any condition in which a part of the body weakens or wastes away. In muscular dystrophy , the weakness is in the muscles. An inherited genetic mistake prevents the body from making a protein that helps build muscles and keep them strong. Only males can get certain types of muscular dystrophy because of how the disease is inherited.
Children who are born with muscular dystrophy usually develop normally for the first few years of life. They may suddenly show signs of clumsiness. These signs include:

Over time, children with muscular dystrophy can become weaker and weaker, losing the ability to sit, walk, and lift objects. Because the disease can also affect muscles in the heart and lungs , shortness of breath and abnormal heart rhythms can occur.
There are several types of muscular dystrophy. Muscle weakness is a hallmark of each type. But the symptoms can vary and start at different ages.
Some muscular dystrophies are mild. Others are more serious and can cause life-threatening muscle weakness.
bullets: Difficulty raising the front of their foot (called foot drop )

An inherited genetic mistake prevents the body from making a protein that helps build muscles and keep them strong. Only males can get certain types of muscular dystrophy because of how the disease is inherited.
Children who are born with muscular dystrophy usually develop normally for the first few years of life. They may suddenly show signs of clumsiness. These signs include:
associated_bullets: Difficulty raising the front of their foot (called foot drop )

content_blocks.text: Over time, children with muscular dystrophy can become weaker and weaker, losing the ability to sit, walk, and lift objects. Because the disease can also affect muscles in the heart and lungs , shortness of breath and abnormal heart rhythms can occur.
There are several types of muscular dystrophy. Muscle weakness is a hallmark of each type. But the symptoms can vary and start at different ages.
Some muscular dystrophies are mild. Others are more serious and can cause life-threatening muscle weakness.

sections.heading: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
content: Duchenne muscular dystrophy is the most common and severe form of the disease. It usually starts when a child is between ages 2 and 5.
Symptoms of Duchenne muscular dystrophy include:

Most children with Duchenne muscular dystrophy will need a wheelchair to get around by the time they're teenagers. The disease also damages the heart and the muscles needed to breathe, which can be life-threatening.
bullets: Muscle weakness that begins in the hips, pelvis, and legs
Trouble learning to sit independently and walk
Walking on the toes or balls of the feet
Difficulty rising from a lying or sitting position
Larger-than-normal calves that are sometimes painful
Curvature of the spine ( scoliosis ). This can cause one hip to be higher than the other.
Breathing problems that may eventually require the use of a ventilator

content_blocks.text: Duchenne muscular dystrophy is the most common and severe form of the disease. It usually starts when a child is between ages 2 and 5.
Symptoms of Duchenne muscular dystrophy include:
associated_bullets: Muscle weakness that begins in the hips, pelvis, and legs
Trouble learning to sit independently and walk
Walking on the toes or balls of the feet
Difficulty rising from a lying or sitting position
Larger-than-normal calves that are sometimes painful
Curvature of the spine ( scoliosis ). This can cause one hip to be higher than the other.
Breathing problems that may eventually require the use of a ventilator

content_blocks.text: Most children with Duchenne muscular dystrophy will need a wheelchair to get around by the time they're teenagers. The disease also damages the heart and the muscles needed to breathe, which can be life-threatening.

sections.heading: Becker Muscular Dystrophy
content: The symptoms of Becker muscular dystrophy are similar to those of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. But Becker muscular dystrophy starts later -- around the teen years. It also develops much more slowly.

sections.heading: Becker Muscular Dystrophy
content: The symptoms of Becker muscular dystrophy are similar to those of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. But Becker muscular dystrophy starts later -- around the teen years. It also develops much more slowly.

content_blocks.text: The symptoms of Becker muscular dystrophy are similar to those of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. But Becker muscular dystrophy starts later -- around the teen years. It also develops much more slowly.

content: The first signs of Becker muscular dystrophy may be trouble walking fast, running, and climbing stairs. Other symptoms may include:
Often children with Becker muscular dystrophy can walk. As they get older they may need to use a cane or wheelchair to get around.
bullets: Muscle weakness that starts in the pelvis, shoulders, hips, and thighs
Trouble lifting objects above waist height because of shoulder and arm weakness
Heart and breathing problems (later in life)

content_blocks.text: The first signs of Becker muscular dystrophy may be trouble walking fast, running, and climbing stairs. Other symptoms may include:
associated_bullets: Muscle weakness that starts in the pelvis, shoulders, hips, and thighs
Trouble lifting objects above waist height because of shoulder and arm weakness
Heart and breathing problems (later in life)

content_blocks.text: Often children with Becker muscular dystrophy can walk. As they get older they may need to use a cane or wheelchair to get around.

sections.heading: Myotonic Dystrophy
content: The symptoms of myotonic dystrophy may be obvious from birth or they can develop later -- during the teenage or adult years.

Like other forms of muscular dystrophy, myotonic dystrophy leads to muscle weakness that gets worse over time, leading to an inability to intentionally relax muscle. It usually affects small muscles first, such as those in the:
Symptoms of myotonic dystrophy can start at any time in a person's life. The symptoms include:
The type of myotonic dystrophy that begins at birth is more serious. Other forms get worse very slowly, and can take 50 or 60 years to progress.
bullets: Weakness in the muscles of the face, arms, hands, and neck
Muscle stiffness (myotonia) -- difficulty relaxing the muscles after they are tightened
Shrinking of the muscles over time (muscle wasting)
Cataracts -- clouding of the eye's lens
Heart problems, including irregular heartbeat ( arrhythmia )

sections.heading: Limb-Girdle Muscular Dystrophy
content: This form of muscular dystrophy is actually a group of related conditions. It usually starts in childhood or during the teenage years.
Often the muscles that become weak first are the big muscles of the:
The muscle weakness gets worse very slowly.
Other symptoms include:
How serious the effects are depends on the child. Some children have only mild muscle weakness. Others are so weak they need to use a wheelchair.
In its later stages, limb-girdle muscular dystrophy can cause serious heart problems.
bullets: Loss of muscle in affected areas

sections.heading: Facioscapulohumeral Muscular Dystrophy
content: Usually this type of muscular dystrophy doesn't appear until the teenage years or later in life. It also gets worse very slowly. Some people may not realize they have it until they are already in their 30s or 40s.
Symptoms include:
bullets: Muscle weakness in the face. This affects the person's ability to close the eyes and purse the lips (whistle).
Muscle weakness in the shoulders, upper arms, upper back, and lower legs
Difficulty raising the arms or lifting objects because of muscle weakness in the shoulders and back

content_blocks.text: Usually this type of muscular dystrophy doesn't appear until the teenage years or later in life. It also gets worse very slowly. Some people may not realize they have it until they are already in their 30s or 40s.
Symptoms include:
associated_bullets: Muscle weakness in the face. This affects the person's ability to close the eyes and purse the lips (whistle).
Muscle weakness in the shoulders, upper arms, upper back, and lower legs
Difficulty raising the arms or lifting objects because of muscle weakness in the shoulders and back

content: One side of the body may be more seriously affected than the other.
If your child has symptoms of any type of muscular dystrophy, see your pediatrician to see what further evaluation is needed.

meta_description: WebMD explains the symptoms of different types of muscular dystrophy, including Duchene, Becker, and myotonic.
